title: [BUG] .NET MAUI App crashes on iOS while starting (SkiaSharp.Views.Maui 2.88.3)
body:
**Description**

I am trying to use SkiaSharp in a .NET MAUI application (.NET 6.0). After the deployment to local device (iPad), when i try to start the app, it crashes with the following error code :

**Output Message**
```
[0:] An error occurred: '@rpath/libSkiaSharp.framework/libSkiaSharp'. Callstack: '   at SkiaSharp.SKPaint..ctor()
   at MauiApp1_60.MainPage..ctor() in D:\Projeler\TEMP\MauiApp1-60\MainPage.xaml.cs:line 13
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeConstructorInfo.InternalInvoke(Object obj, Object[] parameters, Boolean wrapExceptions)'
The app has been terminated.
```

App crashes only when i try to deploy to iPad. For Android and Windows, it works.

In the code I am just trying to call the ctor of SKPaint class with the following code :

```
public MainPage()
	{
		InitializeComponent();

		var a = new SKPaint();
	}

```
When i remove the construction of SKPaint(), the app deploys and runs on iPad. 

I also added the .UseSkiaSharp() command in MauiProgram class as :

```
public static MauiApp CreateMauiApp()
	{
		var builder = MauiApp.CreateBuilder();
		builder
			.UseMauiApp<App>()
			.UseSkiaSharp()
			.ConfigureFonts(fonts =>
			{
				fonts.AddFont("OpenSans-Regular.ttf", "OpenSansRegular");
				fonts.AddFont("OpenSans-Semibold.ttf", "OpenSansSemibold");
			});

		return builder.Build();
	}
```

**Expected Behavior**

Creating an instance of a SKPaint class.

**Actual Behavior**

App crashes

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  
   SkiaSharp.Views.Maui.Controls (2.88.3), 
   SkiaSharp.Views.Maui.Controls.Compatibility (2.88.3)
   SkiaSharp.Views.Maui.Core(2.88.3)

- IDE:  
  Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2022 (64-bit) - Current Version 17.5.0 (Windows 11)
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  iOS:  13.6
- Target Devices:  
  iPad 9. Generation, iPadOs : 16.3.1

<details>
  <summary>Detailed IDE/OS information (click to expand)</summary>
